intro: Dilivaria polystachya, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers bloom in clusters, producing a striking visual display during the wet season.
